Nutella Hot Chocolate with Frangelico

Jump to Recipe

Indulge in the ultimate cozy drink with our Nutella Hot Chocolate with Frangelico recipe! This decadent beverage combines the rich, creamy flavors of Nutella with the smooth, nutty notes of Frangelico liqueur, making it the perfect treat for cold nights or festive gatherings. Whether you're looking to impress guests at a holiday party or simply want to enjoy a luxurious cup of hot chocolate, this recipe is sure to satisfy your cravings. With just a few simple ingredients, including milk, Nutella, and whipped cream, you can create a delightful drink that’s both comforting and sophisticated. Join us as we guide you through the steps to create this deliciously indulgent hot chocolate that will warm your heart and elevate your winter evenings!

Ingredients

milk

Use whole milk for a creamier texture, but you can substitute with almond milk or oat milk for a dairy-free option. If you're looking for a richer flavor, consider using half-and-half or adding a splash of heavy cream. Always warm the milk gently to avoid scorching.

nutella

If Nutella is unavailable, you can substitute with any chocolate hazelnut spread. For a homemade version, blend hazelnuts with cocoa powder, sugar, and a little oil. To enhance the chocolate flavor, add a pinch of cocoa powder or dark chocolate.

frangelico liqueur

If you don't have Frangelico, try substituting with hazelnut syrup or another nut-flavored liqueur like Amaretto. For a non-alcoholic version, use a hazelnut extract or syrup to mimic the flavor.

whipped cream

For a richer whipped cream, consider adding a touch of vanilla extract or a sprinkle of powdered sugar while whipping. You can also use store-bought whipped cream or whipped topping for convenience.

chocolate shavings or cocoa powder

If you're using chocolate shavings, consider using dark or white chocolate for contrast. Cocoa powder can be sweetened if desired, or you can use a flavored cocoa powder for added depth. You can also substitute with crushed nuts or sprinkles for a different texture.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Heat the Milk

    In a small saucepan, heat 2 cups of milk over medium heat. Stir occasionally to prevent it from scorching. You want the milk to be warm but not boiling. Boiling can change the texture of the milk and make it less creamy.

  • Step 2: Add Nutella

    Once the milk is warm, add 1/2 cup of Nutella. Whisk it vigorously until the Nutella is completely melted and the mixture is smooth. This step is crucial for achieving that rich, chocolatey flavor.

  • Step 3: Incorporate Frangelico

    Stir in 2 tablespoons of Frangelico liqueur into the Nutella and milk mixture. This adds a delightful hazelnut flavor that complements the Nutella beautifully. Make sure it’s well combined.

  • Step 4: Serve Hot Chocolate

    Pour the Nutella hot chocolate into your favorite mugs. This recipe should yield about 2 servings depending on the size of your mugs.

  • Step 5: Top with Whipped Cream

    Generously top each mug of hot chocolate with whipped cream. You can use store-bought whipped cream or make your own for an extra touch of indulgence.

  • Step 6: Garnish

    Finish by garnishing with chocolate shavings or a sprinkle of cocoa powder. This not only adds to the presentation but enhances the chocolate flavor.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I measure 2 cups of milk accurately?

Use a liquid measuring cup for best results. Fill it to the 2-cup line while ensuring you’re at eye level to get an accurate measurement.

What’s the best way to warm milk without scalding it?

Heat the milk over medium heat and stir frequently. Avoid bringing it to a boil; you want it to be steaming hot but not bubbling.

How do I incorporate Nutella into the milk smoothly?

Add Nutella to the warm milk gradually while whisking continuously. This helps it melt evenly and prevents clumping.

Can I substitute Frangelico with something else?

Yes! If you prefer a non-alcoholic version, you can use hazelnut syrup or simply omit it for a delicious chocolate flavor.

What’s the best way to whip cream at home?

Use heavy cream and a chilled mixing bowl. Whip with an electric mixer on medium speed until soft peaks form, usually after about 3-5 minutes.

How do I make chocolate shavings for garnish?

Use a vegetable peeler to shave a chocolate bar. Alternatively, you can use a grater for finer shavings.

Can I make this recipe in a larger batch?

Absolutely! Just multiply the ingredients by the number of servings you want, keeping the same proportions.

How can I store leftover hot chocolate?

You can store it in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat gently on the stove or in the microwave before serving.

What’s a good way to make this recipe more decadent?

You can add a pinch of sea salt to enhance the flavor, or mix in some mini marshmallows for an extra treat!

What should I do if my hot chocolate is too thick?

If it’s too thick, simply whisk in a little extra milk until you reach your desired consistency.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a dairy-free version, substitute the milk with almond milk or oat milk. To make it vegan, replace the whipped cream with coconut whipped cream and ensure that the Nutella used is dairy-free (many brands offer vegan Nutella alternatives). If gluten-free options are needed, serve with gluten-free cookies or desserts.

Pairings

This Nutella Hot Chocolate with Frangelico pairs beautifully with a slice of hazelnut cake or biscotti for a delightful treat. For an adult gathering, consider serving it alongside spiced nuts or a cheese platter featuring creamy cheeses like brie or camembert. As for beverages, a sweet dessert wine such as Moscato or a rich coffee like espresso can complement the flavors well.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Nutella Hot Chocolate in clear glass mugs to showcase the rich color and toppings. For a cozy atmosphere, consider warming the mugs beforehand by rinsing them with hot water. Present with a small plate of chocolate-dipped strawberries or marshmallows on the side for an interactive dessert experience. Adding a drizzle of chocolate or caramel over the whipped cream can elevate the presentation.
